content.title: Protamine Sulfate Reversal
content.description: Positively charged polypeptide that neutralizes heparin by ionic binding, used to reverse heparin anticoagulation after vascular procedures.
content.mechanism: Protamine (highly cationic) binds heparin (highly anionic) forming inactive complex. Does NOT reverse anti-Xa activity of LMWH well.

dosing.for_UFH: 1mg protamine per 100 units heparin given in previous 2-3 hours

adverse_effects.anaphylaxis: Risk factors: prior protamine, fish allergy, NPH insulin
adverse_effects.paradoxical_anticoagulation: Excess protamine has weak anticoagulant effect

clinical_considerations.partial_reversal: Often 50% dose given to maintain some anticoagulation
clinical_considerations.rebounding: Heparin effect may return if protamine clears before residual heparin

content.lmwh_reversal: Only partially reverses LMWH; consider fresh frozen plasma, prothrombin complex
